member.summary: A collection of interactive fields for gathering data from a user through dropdowns, textboxes, checkboxes, etc. Each with form functionality contains a single spread across one or more pages.
member.remarks: The name AcroForm distinguishes this from the other form type called form XObjects which act as templates for repeated sections of content.

member.summary: Specifies characteristics of an annotation in a PDF or FDF document.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Invisible
member.summary: Do not display the annotation if it is not one of the standard annotation types.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Hidden
member.summary: Do not display or print the annotation irrespective of type. Do not allow interaction.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Print
member.summary: The annotation should be included when the document is physically printed.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoZoom
member.summary: Do not zoom/scale the annotation as the zoom of the document is changed.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoRotate
member.summary: Do not rotate the annotation as the page is rotated.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.NoView
member.summary: Do not display the annotation in viewer applications as with , however allow the annotation to be printed if is set.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: Allow the annotation to be displayed/printed if applicable but do not respond to user interaction, e.g. mouse clicks.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.Locked
member.summary: Do not allow deleting the annotation or changing size/position but allow the contents to be modified.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.ToggleNoView
member.summary: Invert the meaning of the flag.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Annotations.AnnotationFlags.LockedContents
member.summary: Allow the annotation to be deleted, resized, moved or restyled but disallow changes to the annotation contents. Opposite to .

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTable
member.summary: The cross-reference table contains information that enables random access to PDF objects within the file by object number so that specific objects can be located directly without having to scan the whole document. A PDF document may contain multiple cross reference tables, this class provides access to the merged result with the latest offset for each object. The offsets of the original cross reference tables or streams merged into this result are available in the list.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTable.ObjectOffsets
member.summary: The corresponding byte offset for each keyed object in this document.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTable.Type
member.summary: The type of the first cross-reference table located in this document.

member.summary: The trailer dictionary.

member.summary: The byte offsets of each cross-reference table or stream in this document and the previous table or stream they link to if applicable.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTable.CrossReferenceOffset
member.summary: The offset of a cross-reference table or stream in the document.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTable.CrossReferenceOffset.Current
member.summary: The offset in bytes from the start of the document where the stream or table starts.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTable.CrossReferenceOffset.Previous
member.summary: The offset in bytes from the start of the document where the previous stream or table in a document containing incremental updates can be found, if applicable.

member.name: M:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTable.CrossReferenceOffset.#ctor(System.Int64,System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: Create a new .
member.param: The offset in bytes from the start of the document where the stream or table starts.
The offset in bytes from the start of the document where the previous stream or table in a document starts.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTableBuilder
member.remarks: The table contains a one-line entry for each indirect object, specifying the location of that object within the body of the file.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceTablePart
member.remarks:
The format of an in-use entry is nnnnnnnnnn ggggg n eol where nnnnnnnnnn is a 10-digit byte offset ggggg is a 5-digit generation number n is a literal keyword identifying this as an in-use entry eol is a 2-character end-of-line sequence
The byte offset is a 10-digit number, padded with leading zeros if necessary, giving the number of bytes from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the object.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.CrossReferenceType
member.summary: The type of a cross-reference section in a PDF document.

member.summary: A cross-reference stream.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.CrossReference.TrailerDictionary.Size
member.summary: The total number of object entries across both the original cross-reference table and in any incremental updates.
member.remarks: Any object in a cross-reference section whose number is greater than this value is ignored and considered missing.

member.summary: The offset in bytes to the previous cross-reference table or stream if the document has more than one cross-reference section.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.DocumentLayoutAnalysis.ClusteringAlgorithms
member.summary: Clustering Algorithms.
Algorithm to group elements via transitive closure, using nearest neighbours and maximum distance. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transitive_closure
member.param: Array of elements to group.
The distance measure between two points.
The function that determines the maximum distance between two points in the same cluster.
The pivot's point to use for pairing, e.g. BottomLeft, TopLeft.
The candidates' point to use for pairing, e.g. BottomLeft, TopLeft.
Filter to apply to the pivot point. If false, point will not be paired at all, e.g. is white space.
Filter to apply to both the pivot and the paired point. If false, point will not be paired at all, e.g. pivot and paired point have same font.

member.summary: Algorithm to group elements via transitive closure, using nearest neighbours and maximum distance. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transitive_closure
member.param: Array of elements to group.
The distance measure between two lines.
The function that determines the maximum distance between two points in the same cluster.
The pivot's line to use for pairing.
The candidates' line to use for pairing.
Filter to apply to the pivot point. If false, point will not be paired at all, e.g. is white space.
Filter to apply to both the pivot and the paired point. If false, point will not be paired at all, e.g. pivot and paired point have same font.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.DocumentLayoutAnalysis.DocstrumBB
member.summary:
The Docstrum algorithm is a bottom-up page segmentation technique based on nearest-neighbourhood clustering of connected components extracted from the document. This implementation leverages bounding boxes and does not exactly replicates the original algorithm.
See 'The document spectrum for page layout analysis.' by L. OGorman.

member.summary:
Get the blocks.
Uses wlAngleLB = -30, wlAngleUB = 30, blAngleLB = -135, blAngleUB = -45, blMulti = 1.3.

member.summary: Get the blocks. See original paper for more information.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.DocumentLayoutAnalysis.RecursiveXYCut
member.summary:
The recursive X-Y cut is a top-down page segmentation technique that decomposes a document recursively into a set of rectangular blocks. This implementation leverages bounding boxes. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recursive_X-Y_cut
See 'Recursive X-Y Cut using Bounding Boxes of Connected Components' by Jaekyu Ha, Robert M.Haralick and Ihsin T. Phillips

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Encryption.CryptDictionary.Method
member.summary: The method used by the consumer application to decrypt data.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Encryption.CryptDictionary.Method.None
member.summary: The application does not decrypt data but directs the input stream to the security handler for decryption.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Encryption.CryptDictionary.Method.V2
member.summary: The application asks the security handler for the encryption key and implicitly decrypts data using the RC4 algorithm.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Encryption.CryptDictionary.Method.AesV2
member.summary: (PDF 1.6) The application asks the security handler for the encryption key and implicitly decrypts data using the AES algorithm in Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode with a 16-byte block size and an initialization vector that is randomly generated and placed as the first 16 bytes in the stream or string.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Encryption.CryptDictionary.Method.AesV3
member.summary: The application asks the security handler for the encryption key and implicitly decrypts data using the AES-256 algorithm in Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) with padding mode with a 16-byte block size and an initialization vector that is randomly generated and placed as the first 16 bytes in the stream or string. The key size shall be 256 bits.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Encryption.CryptDictionary.TriggerEvent
member.summary: The event to be used to trigger the authorization that is required to access encryption keys used by this filter.

member.summary: Optional: Integer pairs similar to however these are used to enforce consistency across a font family when there are small differences (<1px) in font alignment.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.AdobeStylePrivateDictionary.FamilyOtherBlues
member.summary: Optional: Integer pairs similar to however these are used to enforce consistency across a font family with small differences in alignment similarly to .

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.AdobeStylePrivateDictionary.BlueScale
member.summary: Optional: The point size at which overshoot suppression stops. The value is a related to the number of pixels tall that one character space unit will be before overshoot suppression is switched off. Overshoot suppression enforces features to snap to alignment zones when the point size is below that affected by this value. Default: 0.039625
member.example: A blue scale of 0.039625 switches overshoot suppression off at 10 points on a 300 dpi device using the formula (for 300 dpi): BlueScale = (pointsize - 0.49)/240 For example, if you wish overshoot suppression to turn off at 11 points on a 300-dpi device, you should set BlueScale to (11 0.49) 240 or 0.04379

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.AdobeStylePrivateDictionary.BlueShift
member.summary: Optional: The character space distance beyond the flat position of alignment zones at which overshoot enforcement occurs. Default: 7

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.AdobeStylePrivateDictionary.BlueFuzz
member.summary: Optional: The number of character space units to extend an alignment zone on a horizontal stem. If the top or bottom of a horizontal stem is within BlueFuzz units outside a top-zone then the stem top/bottom is treated as if it were within the zone. Default: 1

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.AdobeStylePrivateDictionary.StandardHorizontalWidth

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.AdobeStylePrivateDictionary.StandardVerticalWidth
member.summary: Optional: The dominant width of vertical stems horizontally in character space units.

member.summary: Optional: Up to 12 numbers with the most common widths for horizontal stems vertically in character space units.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.AdobeStylePrivateDictionary.StemSnapVerticalWidths

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.CompactFontFormat.CharStrings.Type2CharStringParser
member.summary: Decodes the commands and numbers making up a Type 2 CharString. A Type 2 CharString extends on the Type 1 CharString format. Compared to the Type 1 format, the Type 2 encoding offers smaller size and an opportunity for better rendering quality and performance. The Type 2 charstring operators are (with one exception) a superset of the Type 1 operators.
member.remarks: A Type 2 charstring program is a sequence of unsigned 8-bit bytes that encode numbers and operators. The byte value specifies a operator, a number, or subsequent bytes that are to be interpreted in a specific manner

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.Standard14
member.summary: There are 14 special Type 1 fonts which must be available. The list of PostScript names for these is given in the remarks section. A font dictionary for a standard 14 font may omit the FirstChar, LastChar, Widths and FontDescriptor entries. The metrics for these fonts are provided by the Adobe Font Metrics (AFM) files.
member.remarks:
Standard 14 fonts are deprecated as of PDF 1.5+ however support is still required for backwards compatibility.
The standard 14 are:
TimesRoman
Helvetica
Courier
Symbol
TimesBold
HelveticaBold
CourierBold
ZapfDingbats
TimesItalic
HelveticaOblique
CourierOblique
TimesBoldItalic
HelveticaBoldOblique
CourierBoldOblique

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Table.FamilyClass

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Table.Panose
member.summary: The PANOSE definition of 10 bytes defines various information about the font enabling matching fonts based on requirements. The meaning of each byte in the PANOSE definition depends on the preceding bytes. The first byte is the family type, Lating, Latin Hand Written, etc.

member.summary: The minimum Unicode character code in this font.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Table.LastCharacterIndex

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version1Table
member.summary: Version 1 was defined in TrueType revision 1.66. Version 1 has two additional fields beyond those in version 0.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version1Table.CodePage1
member.summary: This field is used to specify the code pages encompassed by the font file in the 'cmap' subtable for the Microsoft platform(3), Unicode BMP encoding (1).

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version1Table.CodePage2
member.summary: This field is the second byte used to specify the code pages encompassed by the font file in the 'cmap' subtable for the Microsoft platform(3), Unicode BMP encoding (1).

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version2To4OpenTypeTable
member.summary: Version 4 was defined in OpenType 1.5. Version 4 has the same fields as in version 2 and version 3. Although new fields were not added beyond those in version 2 and 3, the specification of certain fields was revised.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version2To4OpenTypeTable.XHeight
member.summary: This metric specifies the distance between the baseline and the approximate height of non-ascending lowercase letters.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version2To4OpenTypeTable.CapHeight
member.summary: This metric specifies the distance between the baseline and the approximate height of uppercase letters.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version2To4OpenTypeTable.DefaultCharacter
member.summary: This is the Unicode code point, in UTF-16 encoding, of a character that can be used for a default glyph if a requested character is not supported. If the value of this field is zero, glyph Id 0 is to be used for the default character.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version2To4OpenTypeTable.BreakCharacter
member.summary: This is the Unicode code point, in UTF-16 encoding, of a character that can be used as a default break character. The break character is used to separate words and justify text. Most fonts specify U+0020 SPACE as the break character.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version2To4OpenTypeTable.MaximumContext
member.summary: The maximum distance in glyphs that any feature of this font is capable of effecting. For example kerning has a value of 2 (1 for each glyph in the kerning pair). Fonts with the 'f f i' ligature would have a value of 3.
Create a new .

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version5OpenTypeTable
member.summary: Version 5 was defined in OpenType 1.7. Version 5 has two additional fields beyond those in versions 2 - 4.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version5OpenTypeTable.LowerOpticalPointSize
member.summary: This value is the lower value of the size range for which this font has been designed. The units for this field are TWIPs (one-twentieth of a point, or 1440 per inch). This is the inclusive lower bound.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.Os2Version5OpenTypeTable.UpperOpticalPointSize
member.summary: This value is the upper value of the size range for which this font has been designed. The units for this field are TWIPs (one-twentieth of a point, or 1440 per inch). This is the exclusive upper bound.
Create a new .

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.PostScriptTable
member.summary: This table contains information for TrueType fonts on PostScript printers. This includes data for the FontInfo dictionary and the PostScript glyph names.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.TrueType.Tables.PostScriptTable.FormatType
member.summary:
Format 1 contains the 258 standard Mac TrueType font file.
Format 2 is the Microsoft font format.
Format 2.5 is a space optimised subset of the standard Mac glyph set.
Format 3 enables a special font type which provides no PostScript information.

member.summary: Declares the vertical ranges of three horizontal stem zones: 1st: between y0 and y0 + dy0 2nd: between y1 and y1 + dy1 3rd: between y2 and y2 + dy2 Where y0, y1 and y2 are all relative to the y coordinate of the left sidebearing point.

member.remarks: Suited to letters with 3 vertical stems, for instance 'm'.

member.summary: Relative rcurveto. Whereas the arguments to the rcurveto operator in the PostScript language are all relative to the current point, the arguments to rrcurveto are relative to each other. Equivalent to: dx1 dy1 (dx1+dx2) (dy1+dy2) (dx1+dx2+dx3) (dy1+dy2+dy3) rcurveto.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.Type1.CharStrings.Commands.PathConstruction.RMoveToCommand
member.summary: Relative move to command. starts a new subpath of the current path in the same manner as moveto. However, the number pair is interpreted as a displacement relative to the current point (x, y) rather than as an absolute coordinate.
member.remarks: moveto: moveto sets the current point in the graphics state to the user space coordinate (x, y) without adding any line segments to the current path. If the previous path operation in the current path was also a moveto or rmoveto, that point is deleted from the current path and the new moveto point replaces it.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.Type1.CharStrings.Commands.StartFinishOutline.HsbwCommand
member.summary: The name hsbw stands for horizontal sidebearing and width; horizontal indicates that the y component of both the sidebearing and width is 0. This command sets the left sidebearing point at (sbx, 0) and sets the character width vector to(wx, 0) in character space. This command also sets the current point to (sbx, 0), but does not place the point in the character path.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.Type1.CharStrings.Type1CharStringParser
member.summary: Decodes a set of CharStrings to their corresponding Type 1 BuildChar operations.
member.remarks:
A charstring is an encrypted sequence of unsigned 8-bit bytes that encode integers and commands. Type 1 BuildChar, when interpreting a charstring, will first decrypt it and then will decode its bytes one at a time in sequence.
The value in a byte indicates a command, a number, or subsequent bytes that are to be interpreted in a special way.
Once the bytes are decoded into numbers and commands, the execution of these numbers and commands proceeds in a manner similar to the operation of the PostScript language. Type 1 BuildChar uses its own operand stack, called the Type 1 BuildChar operand stack, that is distinct from the PostScript interpreter operand stack.
This stack holds up to 24 numeric entries. A number, decoded from a charstring, is pushed onto the Type 1 BuildChar operand stack. A command expects its arguments in order on this operand stack with all arguments generally taken from the bottom of the stack (first argument bottom-most); however, some commands, particularly the subroutine commands, normally work from the top of the stack. If a command returns results, they are pushed onto the Type 1 BuildChar operand stack (last result topmost).

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Fonts.Type1.Type1PrivateDictionary
member.summary: The Private dictionary for a Type 1 font contains hints that apply across all characters in the font. These hints help preserve properties of character outline shapes when rendered at smaller sizes and lower resolutions. These hints help ensure that the shape is as close as possible to the original design even where the character must be represented in few pixels. Note that subroutines are also defined in the private dictionary however for the purposes of this API they are stored on the parent .

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace
member.summary: Color values in a PDF are interpreted according to the current color space. Color spaces enable a PDF to specify abstract colors in a device independent way.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.DeviceGray
member.summary: Grayscale. Controls the intensity of achromatic light on a scale from black to white.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.DeviceRGB
member.summary: RGB. Controls the intensities of red, green and blue light.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.DeviceCMYK
member.summary: CMYK. Controls the concentrations of cyan, magenta, yellow and black (K) inks.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.CalGray
member.summary: CIE (Commission Internationale de l'clairage) colorspace. Specifies color related to human visual perception with the aim of producing consistent color on different output devices. CalGray - Special case of the CIE colorspace using a single channel (A) and a single transformation. A represents the gray component of a calibrated gray space in the range 0 to 1.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.CalRGB
member.summary: CIE (Commission Internationale de l'clairage) colorspace. Specifies color related to human visual perception with the aim of producing consistent color on different output devices. CalRGB - A CIE ABC color space with a single transformation. A, B and C represent red, green and blue color values in the range 0 to 1.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.Lab
member.summary: CIE (Commission Internationale de l'clairage) colorspace. Specifies color related to human visual perception with the aim of producing consistent color on different output devices. Lab - A CIE ABC color space with two transforms. A, B and C represent the L*, a* and b* components of a CIE 1976 L*a*b* space. The range of A (L*) is 0 to 100. The range of B (a*) and C (b*) are defined by the Range of the color space.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.ICCBased
member.summary: ICC (International Color Consortium) colorspace. ICC - Colorspace specified by a sequence of bytes which are interpreted according to the ICC specification.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.Indexed
member.summary: An Indexed color space allows a PDF content stream to use small integers as indices into a color map or color table of arbitrary colors in some other space. A PDF consumer application treats each sample value as an index into the color table and uses the color value it finds there.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.Pattern
member.summary: Enables a PDF content stream to paint an area with a pattern rather than a single color. The pattern may be either a tiling pattern (type 1) or a shading pattern (type 2).

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.Separation
member.summary: Provides a means for specifying the use of additional colorants or for isolating the control of individual color components of a device color space for a subtractive device. When such a space is the current color space, the current color is a single-component value, called a tint, that controls the application of the given colorant or color components only.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpace.DeviceN
member.summary: Can contain an arbitrary number of color components. They provide greater flexibility than is possible with standard device color spaces such as or with individual color spaces. For example, it is possible to create a DeviceN color space consisting of only the cyan, magenta, and yellow color components, with the black component excluded.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpaceExtensions
member.summary: Provides utility extension methods for dealing with s.

member.summary: Gets the corresponding for a given .

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpaceFamily
member.summary: s can be classified into colorspace families. s within the same family share general characteristics.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpaceFamily.Device
member.summary: Device colorspaces directly specify colors or shades of gray that the output device should produce.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpaceFamily.CIEBased
member.summary: CIE-based color spaces are based on an international standard for color specification created by the Commission Internationale de l'clairage (International Commission on Illumination) (CIE). These spaces specify colors in a way that is independent of the characteristics of any particular output device.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Colors.ColorSpaceFamily.Special
member.summary: Special color spaces add features or properties to an underlying color space. They include facilities for patterns, color mapping, separations, and high-fidelity and multitone color.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineCapStyle
member.summary: The line cap style specifies the shape to be used at the ends of open subpaths (and dashes, if any) when they are stroked.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineCapStyle.Butt
member.summary: The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineCapStyle.Round
member.summary: A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineCapStyle.ProjectingSquare
member.summary: The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is squared off.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineDashPattern
member.summary: The line dash pattern controls the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths. It is specified by a dash array and a dash phase.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineDashPattern.Phase
member.summary: The distance into the dash pattern at which to start the dash.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineDashPattern.Array
member.summary: The numbers that specify the lengths of alternating dashes and gaps.

member.name: M:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineDashPattern.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.Decimal})
member.summary: Create a new .
member.param: The phase. .
The array. .

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineDashPattern.Solid
member.summary: The default solid line.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineJoinStyle
member.summary: The line join style specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths that are stroked.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineJoinStyle.Miter
member.summary: The outer edges of the strokes for the two segments are extended until they meet at an angle, as in a picture frame. If the segments meet at too sharp an angle (as defined by the miter limit parameter), a bevel join is used instead.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineJoinStyle.Round
member.summary: An arc of a circle with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the point where the two segments meet, connecting the outer edges of the strokes for the two segments

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.LineJoinStyle.Bevel
member.summary: The two segments are finished with butt caps and the resulting notch beyond the ends of the segments is filled with a triangle.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.RenderingIntent
member.summary: Specifying a rendering intent allows a PDF file to set priorities regarding which properties to preserve and which to sacrifice for CIE colors.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.RenderingIntent.AbsoluteColorimetric
member.summary: No correction for the output medium's white point. Colors only represented relative to the light source.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.RenderingIntent.RelativeColorimetric
member.summary: Combines light source and output medium's white point.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.RenderingIntent.Saturation
member.summary: Emphasises saturation rather than colorimetric accuracy.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.RenderingIntent.Perceptual
member.summary: Modifies from colorimetric values to provide a "pleasing perceptual appearance".

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode
member.summary: The text rendering mode determines whether showing text causes glyph outlines to be stroked, filled, used as a clipping boundary, or some combination of the three.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.Fill
member.summary: Fill text.
member.remarks: Corresponds to filling the entire letter region.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.Stroke
member.summary: Stroke text.
member.remarks: Corresponds to drawing the border/outline of the letter.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.FillThenStroke
member.summary: Fill then stroke text.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.Neither
member.summary: Neither fill nor stroke text thereby causing text to become invisible.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.FillClip
member.summary: Fill the text and add to the clipping path.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.StrokeClip
member.summary: Stroke the text and add to the clipping path.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.FillThenStrokeClip
member.summary: Fill then stroke the text and then add to the clipping path.

member.name: F:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Core.TextRenderingMode.NeitherClip
member.summary: Neither fill nor stroke but add to the clipping path.

member.summary: The current state of text related parameters for a content stream.

member.summary: Whether the font comes from the extended graphics state via the operator.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: A value in unscaled text space units which is added to the horizontal (or vertical if in vertical writing mode) glyph displacement.
member.remarks: In horizontal writing mode a positive value will expand the distance between letters/glyphs. Default value 0.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.WordSpacing
member.summary: As for but applies only for the space character (32).

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.HorizontalScaling
member.summary: Adjusts the width of glyphs/letters by stretching (or compressing) them horizontally. Value is a percentage of the normal width.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.Leading
member.summary: The vertical distance in unscaled text space units between the baselines of lines of text.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.FontName
member.summary: The name of the currently active font.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.FontSize
member.summary: The current font size.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.TextRenderingMode
member.summary: The for glyph outlines.
member.remarks:
When the rendering mode requires filling the current non-stroking color in the state is used.
When the rendering mode requires stroking the current stroking color in the state is used.
The rendering mode has no impact on Type 3 fonts.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.CurrentFontState.Rise
member.summary: The distance in unscaled text space units to move the default baseline either up or down.
member.remarks: Always applies to the vertical coordinate irrespective or writing mode.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Graphics.Operations.TextShowing.ShowText
member.summary: Show a text string

remarks.para: The input is a sequence of character codes to be shown as glyphs.

Generally each byte represents a single character code, however starting in version 1.2+ a composite font might use multi-byte character codes to map to glyphs. For these composite fonts, the of the font defines the mapping from code to glyph.

The grouping of character codes in arguments to this operator does not have any impact on the meaning; for example:
(Abc) Tj is equivalent to (A) Tj (b) Tj (c) Tj
However grouping character codes makes the document easier to search and extract text from.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Parser.FileStructure.FileHeaderParser
member.summary: Used to retrieve the version header from the PDF file.
member.remarks: The first line of a PDF file should be a header consisting of the 5 characters %PDF followed by a version number of the form 1.N, where N is a digit between 0 and 7. A conforming reader should accept files with any of the following headers: %PDF1.0 %PDF1.1 %PDF1.2 %PDF1.3 %PDF1.4 %PDF1.5 %PDF1.6 %PDF1.7 This parser allows versions up to 1.9. For versions equal or greater to PDF 1.4, the optional Version entry in the documents catalog dictionary should be used instead of the header version.

member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed.
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Util.JetBrains.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output.
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally (throws or terminates the process).
Value canbenull is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon. There is no notion of order rows, all rows are checked for applicability and applied per each program state tracked by R# analysis.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("=> true, result: notnull; => false, result: null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Util.JetBrains.Annotations.SourceTemplateAttribute
member.summary: An extension method marked with this attribute is processed by ReSharper code completion as a 'Source Template'. When extension method is completed over some expression, it's source code is automatically expanded like a template at call site.
member.remarks: Template method body can contain valid source code and/or special comments starting with '$'. Text inside these comments is added as source code when the template is applied. Template parameters can be used either as additional method parameters or as identifiers wrapped in two '$' signs. Use the attribute to specify macros for parameters.

member.name: T:UglyToad.PdfPig.Util.JetBrains.Annotations.MacroAttribute
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro for a parameter of a source template.
member.remarks: You can apply the attribute on the whole method or on any of its additional parameters. The macro expression is defined in the property. When applied on a method, the target template parameter is defined in the property. To apply the macro silently for the parameter, set the property value = -1.

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Util.JetBrains.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Expression
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro that will be executed for a source template parameter when the template is expanded.

members.member:
Allows specifying which occurrence of the target parameter becomes editable when the template is deployed.
If the target parameter is used several times in the template, only one occurrence becomes editable; other occurrences are changed synchronously. To specify the zero-based index of the editable occurrence, use values >= 0. To make the parameter non-editable when the template is expanded, use -1. >

member.name: P:UglyToad.PdfPig.Util.JetBrains.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Target
member.summary: Identifies the target parameter of a source template if the is applied on a template method.
